text: Gavin James Creel (April 18, 1976 â€“ September 30, 2024) was an American actor and pop singer-songwriter. He was best known for his work in musical theater. Creel was born in Findlay, Ohio. His career began in 1997. During his career, he won a Tony Award, a Laurence Olivier Award, a Drama Desk Award and a Grammy Award. Creel had his first Broadway role in 2002 in the leading role of Jimmy in Thoroughly Modern Millie. He later starred as Claude in the 2009 Broadway revival of Hair. From 2012 to 2015, he starred as Elder Price in The Book of Mormon. Creel was openly gay. In 2009, Creel dated actor Jonathan Groff. In July 2024, Creel was diagnosed with a metastatic melanotic peripheral nerve sheath sarcoma. He died from the disease at his home in New York City on September 30, 2024, at the age of 48. ==References== ==Other websites== * (official website) * * * [ Gavin Creel] at Billboard * Gavin Creel on Discogs * * * Category:1976 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:American musical theatre actors Category:American movie actors Category:American voice actors Category:Actors from Ohio Category:Actors from New York City Category:LGBT actors Category:Gay men Category:LGBT people from Ohio Category:LGBT people from New York City Category:Laurence Olivier Award winners Category:Drama Desk Award winners Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Tony Award winning actors Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT songwriters Category:Singer-songwriters from New York City Category:Singers from Ohio Category:Writers from Ohio Category:American pop singers Category:People from Findlay, Ohio
title: Gavin Creel
